question_content.barrons:question: Far from viewing consumption as a romantic, even glamorous disease, an affliction of emotionally enhanced or refined beings, Sontag, steadfastly refusing to idealize the disease, observed that the __________ attaching to consumption eventually diminished as science clarified the cause of the illness, and as treatment became first possible and then routine.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
distinction, cachet.

Note the phrase far from that opens the sentence. This phrase sets up a contract between writers who regarded consumption (tuberculosis) romantically and the writer Susan Sontag, who refused to idealize or romanticize the disease. Sontag instead analyzed the changes in how people came to view consumption, pointing out that the original cachet (prestige; idealized status) or distinction (prestige) of the disease grew less as people learned to treat it.

Therapy is incorrect. The term therapy (healing power; treatment) makes no sense in the context.

Idiosyncrasy is incorrect. The term idiosyncrasy (individual peculiarity; quirk) makes no sense in the context.

Relevance is incorrect. The term relevance (significance) makes no sense in the context.

Duties is incorrect. The term duties (obligations) makes no sense in the context.
